required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Growth Hormones and Cells in Human Milk Depending on Gestational Age
clinical_study.official_title: Growth Hormones and Cells in Human Milk Depending on Gestational Age and Lactation Phase

brief_summary.textblock: Human breast milk contains growth factors including neurotrophins and cells with neuroprotective potential. Concerning growth factors milk of preterms differs significantly from term milk. The aim of this study is to give a profile of human milk concerning non-nutritive factors depending on gestational age and lactation phase.

detailed_description.textblock: Neurotrophins (epidermal growth factor (EGF), vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), nerve growth factor (NGF), brain derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF)) as well as amount of cells, especially positive for sex-determining transformer protein (TRA)-1-81 and stage-specific embryonic antigen (SSEA)-4, are planned to be quantified in human breast milk of extremely preterm newborns as well as term newborns at different stages of lactation.

primary_outcome.description: Concentration of Neurotrophins EGF, VEGF, NGF, BDNF in the human milk

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of cells positive for surface markers TRA-1-81 and SSEA-4
secondary_outcome.description: surface markers characteristic for pluripotent stem cells

biospec_descr.textblock: human breast milk, umbilical chord blood

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- the newborn infant is being fed with own mothers milk
Exclusion Criteria:
- low amount of breast milk

facility.name: Neonatology at the University Hospital of Cologne

results_reference.citation: Keller T, Wengenroth L, Smorra D, Probst K, Kurian L, Kribs A, Brachvogel B. Novel DRAQ5™/SYTOX® Blue Based Flow Cytometric Strategy to Identify and Characterize Stem Cells in Human Breast Milk. Cytometry B Clin Cytom. 2019 Nov;96(6):480-489. doi: 10.1002/cyto.b.21748. Epub 2018 Nov 26.
